alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 25 at 3:18PM PST until February 28 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM SUNDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 2000 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 10 inches with 18 to 24 inches expected in the higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 to 50 mph in the higher terrain. * WHERE...Eastern Curry County and Josephine County, including the Kalmiopsis Wilderness, including Bear Camp Road, highway 199 from Hayes Hill Summit southward. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 10 PM Sunday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 AM to 4 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
